Detailed Description

Watch the table for change notification events.

Member Function Documentation

◆ watch_table()

db_result_t storage::ittiadb::TableWatcher::watch_table ( db_flags_t  watch_flags)

Watch the table for change notification events. If the table is already being watched on this connection, change its event settings.

Parameters
watch_flagsEvent types and scope, a bitwise combination of flags.
  • Following flags control whether or not an event occured:
    • DB_WATCH_ROW_INSERT Notification when new row added to table.
    • DB_WATCH_ROW_UPDATE Notification when existing row updated.
    • DB_WATCH_ROW_DELETE Notification when existing row deleted.
  • Folowing flags limit the scope of the rows obtained by Connection::event_wait:
    • DB_WATCH_PRIMARY_KEY Include a copy of the primary key in the watch row.
    • DB_WATCH_MODIFIED_FIELDS Include a copy of all modified filed in the watch row.
    • DB_WATCH_BOUND_FIELDS Include a copy of all bound fileds in the watch row.
    • DB_WATCH_ALL_FIELDS Include a copy of all fields in the watch row.
  • The following flags control use of the auxiliary row:
    • DB_WATCH_FORMER_VALUES Include the original values for any updated fileds in the watch aux row.
  • The following flags require event to satisfy certain conditions:
    • DB_WATCH_FILTER_MODIFIED Only watch for the event that modify the row (does not restrict insert ot delete).
    • DB_WATCH_FILTER_NOT_SELF Only watch for events that are not caused by the same connection.
Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.

  • DB_FAIL on failure.

    On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

    • DB_EINVAL Caused by: invalid database handle, table name is null, invalid watch flags.
Note
watching a table incurs some overhead even if no event handlers are registered.

◆ unwatch_table()

db_result_t storage::ittiadb::TableWatcher::unwatch_table ( )

Stop watching the table for change notification events. Event handlers remain registered, but will not be called while the table is unwatched.

Always call this function before changing the table's schema.

Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.

  • DB_FAIL on failure.

    On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

    • DB_EINVAL Invalid database handle, table name is null.

◆ register_handler()

void storage::ittiadb::TableWatcher::register_handler ( ITableEventHandler &  handler)

Register an event handler for this table.

If the same event handler is registered multiple times for the same table, the behavior is undefined.

This function is safe to call from other threads while the connection is open. Do not call this function if the connection might be closed.

Parameters
handlerTable event handler

◆ unregister_handler()

void storage::ittiadb::TableWatcher::unregister_handler ( ITableEventHandler &  handler)

Unregister an event handler.

If handler is not registered, this function has no effect.

This function is safe to call from other threads while the connection is open. Do not call this function if the connection might be closed.

Parameters
handlerTable event handler

◆ flags()

db_flags_t storage::ittiadb::TableWatcher::flags ( ) const
inline

Get the change notification flags.

Returns
  • Event types and scope, a bitwise combination of flags.
    • DB_WATCH_ROW_INSERT Notification when new row added to table.
    • DB_WATCH_ROW_UPDATE Notification when existing row updated.
    • DB_WATCH_ROW_DELETE Notification when existing row deleted.
  • Folowing flags limit the scope of the rows obtained by Connection::event_wait:
    • DB_WATCH_PRIMARY_KEY Include a copy of the primary key in the watch row.
    • DB_WATCH_MODIFIED_FIELDS Include a copy of all modified filed in the watch row.
    • DB_WATCH_BOUND_FIELDS Include a copy of all bound fileds in the watch row.
    • DB_WATCH_ALL_FIELDS Include a copy of all fields in the watch row.
  • The following flags control use of the auxiliary row:
    • DB_WATCH_FORMER_VALUES Include the original values for any updated fileds in the watch aux row.
  • The following flags require event to satisfy certain conditions:
    • DB_WATCH_FILTER_MODIFIED Only watch for the event that modify the row (does not restrict insert ot delete).
    • DB_WATCH_FILTER_NOT_SELF Only watch for events that are not caused by the same connection.
